* kalguni@... [rest-discuss] <rest-discuss-noreply@yahoogroups.com> [2015-06-17 03:40]:
> I read lots of articles on these. Yet it seems to be more of
> a personal choice rather than an Industry standard.

It is personal choice. As far as REST is concerned, you can use GUIDs
as your URLs for all the difference it makes. Of course, in practice
“REST API” is code for “HTTP/RPC hybrid” and not at all a hypermedia-
driven design, but even so, it’s up to you. It’s essentially similar
to naming functions or methods – there *is* bad design and bad ideas,
but there is no correctness criterion. (Or like CSS class names, come
to think of it.)
